net.sf.mmm.service.base.client

Class AbstractRemoteInvocationCaller<QUEUE extends RemoteInvocationQueue,CALL extends RemoteInvocationCall,TX_CALLS extends GenericRemoteInvocationTransactionalCalls<CALL>,REQUEST extends GenericRemoteInvocationRequest<CALL,TX_CALLS>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractComponent
      • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractLoggableComponent
        • net.sf.mmm.service.base.client.AbstractRemoteInvocationCaller<QUEUE,CALL,TX_CALLS,REQUEST>
  • Type Parameters:
    QUEUE - is the generic type of the queue. The queue implementation must extend AbstractRemoteInvocationCaller.AbstractRemoteInvocationQueue.
    CALL - is the generic type of the remote invocation call. For command style this is just the RemoteInvocationCommand itself, for RPC style this is GenericRemoteInvocationRpcCall.
    TX_CALLS - is the generic type of the transfer object that wraps a <CALL>-array with the calls to perform in a single transaction.
    REQUEST - is the generic type of the GenericRemoteInvocationRequest to build and send to the server.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeReadDefaultFailureCallback, AttributeWriteDefaultFailureCallback, AttributeWriteTransactionMode, RemoteInvocationCaller<QUEUE>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractRemoteInvocationCommandCaller, AbstractRemoteInvocationServiceCaller

    public abstract class AbstractRemoteInvocationCaller<QUEUE extends RemoteInvocationQueue,CALL extends RemoteInvocationCall,TX_CALLS extends GenericRemoteInvocationTransactionalCalls<CALL>,REQUEST extends GenericRemoteInvocationRequest<CALL,TX_CALLS>>
extends AbstractLoggableComponent
implements RemoteInvocationCaller<QUEUE>, AttributeWriteTransactionMode, AttributeWriteDefaultFailureCallback
    This is the abstract base-implementation of RemoteInvocationCaller.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      This inner calls is a builder for GenericRemoteInvocationTransactionalCalls.

      • newQueue

        public QUEUE newQueue(RemoteInvocationQueueSettings settings)
        This method opens a queue that collects remote invocations to send to the server. If a queue is currently open this method will create a child-queue of that queue.
        Specified by:
        newQueue in interface RemoteInvocationCaller<QUEUE extends RemoteInvocationQueue>
        Parameters:
        settings - are the RemoteInvocationQueueSettings.
        Returns:
        the new queue.

      • newQueueForAutoCommit

        protected QUEUE newQueueForAutoCommit()
        Returns:
        creates a new queue for auto-commit.

      • createQueue

        protected QUEUE createQueue(RemoteInvocationQueueSettings settings)
        This method creates a new AbstractRemoteInvocationCaller.AbstractRemoteInvocationQueue. If a current queue is present, the new queue has to use it as parent.
        Parameters:
        settings - are the RemoteInvocationQueueSettings for the new queue.
        Returns:
        the new AbstractRemoteInvocationCaller.AbstractRemoteInvocationQueue.

      • createQueue

        protected abstract QUEUE createQueue(RemoteInvocationQueueSettings settings,
                                     AbstractRemoteInvocationCaller.AbstractRemoteInvocationQueue parentQueue)
        Parameters:
        settings - are the RemoteInvocationQueueSettings.
        parentQueue - is the parent queue.
        Returns:
        the new queue instance.
        See Also:
        createQueue(RemoteInvocationQueueSettings)

      • getCurrentQueue

        public QUEUE getCurrentQueue()
        This method gets the current queue. This is the last queue that has been created and is still open.
        NOTE:
        This method is only for specific scenarios. You should typically use RemoteInvocationCaller.newQueue() instead, to retrieve a queue and perform service invocations.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentQueue in interface RemoteInvocationCaller<QUEUE extends RemoteInvocationQueue>
        Returns:
        the current queue or null if no queue is open.

      • nextRequestId

        protected int nextRequestId()
        Returns:
        the next request ID.

        Returns:

        public CsrfToken getXsrfToken()
        Returns:

      • performRequest

        protected void performRequest(AbstractRemoteInvocationCaller.AbstractRemoteInvocationQueue queue)
        This method finally performs a request with the invocations collected by the given queue.
        Parameters:
        queue - is the AbstractRemoteInvocationCaller.AbstractRemoteInvocationQueue.

      • performRequest

        protected abstract void performRequest(REQUEST request,
                                       AbstractRemoteInvocationCaller.RequestBuilder builder)
        Actually performs the given request by sending it to the server and handling the response asynchronously.
        Parameters:
        request - is the GenericRemoteInvocationRequest to perform.
        builder - is the AbstractRemoteInvocationCaller.RequestBuilder that created the request and is to be used for handling the results (dispatching to the asynchronous callback functions).

      • handleResponse

        protected void handleResponse(REQUEST request,
                              AbstractRemoteInvocationCaller.RequestBuilder builder,
                              GenericRemoteInvocationResponse response)
        This method should be called from performRequest(GenericRemoteInvocationRequest, RequestBuilder) if a GenericRemoteInvocationResponse has been received.
        Parameters:
        request - is the GenericRemoteInvocationRequest that has been performed.
        builder - is the AbstractRemoteInvocationCaller.RequestBuilder corresponding to the given request.
        response - is the GenericRemoteInvocationResponse to handle.

      • handleFailure

        protected void handleFailure(REQUEST request,
                             AbstractRemoteInvocationCaller.RequestBuilder builder,
                             Throwable failure)
        This method should be called from performRequest(GenericRemoteInvocationRequest, RequestBuilder) if a general failure occurred on the client side (in case of a network error or the like).
        Parameters:
        request - is the GenericRemoteInvocationRequest that has been performed.
        builder - is the AbstractRemoteInvocationCaller.RequestBuilder corresponding to the given request.
        failure - is the Throwable that has been catched on the client.

      • createRemoteInvocationTransactionalCalls

        protected abstract TX_CALLS createRemoteInvocationTransactionalCalls(List<CALL> calls)
        Parameters:
        calls - is the List with the <CALL>s.
        Returns:
        an instance of <TX_CALLS> wrapping the given calls.

        protected abstract REQUEST createRequest(int requestId,
                                         CsrfToken token,
                                         List<TX_CALLS> transactionalCalls)
        Creates a new GenericRemoteInvocationRequest instance.
        Parameters:
        requestId - - see GenericRemoteInvocationRequest.getRequestId().
        token - - see GenericRemoteInvocationRequest.getXsrfToken().
        transactionalCalls - - see GenericRemoteInvocationRequest.getTransactionalCalls().
        Returns:
